dblp.social.preparser
Class PreParser

java.lang.Object
  java.lang.Thread
      dblp.social.preparser.PreParser
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable
public class PreParser
extends java.lang.Thread

This class defines the functions used to validate and pre-parse an XML dblp file.

Author:
Staffiero

Constant Field Values
Constructor Detail

PreParser

public PreParser(java.io.File inputFile)
The constructor to be used to call the preParse method, this will block the execution until the pre-parser finishes . If you use this constructor, then call the preParse(int partNumber, int chkptStep) method to pre parse the given inputFile

Parameters:
inputFile: - the XML file to be pre-parsed

PreParser

public PreParser(java.io.File inputFile,
                 SharedBuffer buffer,
                 int partNumber,
                 int chkptStep,
                 java.awt.Frame parent)
The constructor to be used to call the preParse into a separate thread. If this constructor is used, then call the start() method to start a thread which pre parses the given inputFile.

Parameters:
inputFile: - the XML file to be pre-parsed
buffer: - a synchronized SharedBuffer in which the state of the current pre-parsing is saved and updated (used to show the current progress). If you do not want to display the current progress set this to null.
partNumber: - the number of "_part" files to be generated, it has to be greater than 1
chkptStep: - the number of dblp "main" tags between checkpoints, it has to be greater than 0
parent: - the parent Frame, used to display errors, if parent==null errors are displayed trough logger

PreParser

public PreParser(java.io.File inputFile,
                 SharedBuffer buffer)
The constructor to be used to call the preParse method sequentially using a SharedBuffer as progress monitor. If this constructor is used, then call the preParse(int partNumber, int chkptStep) method to pre parse the given inputFile

Parameters:
inputFile: - the XML file to be pre-parsed
buffer: - a synchronized SharedBuffer in which the state of the current pre-parsing is saved

validateInputFile

public boolean validateInputFile()
                          throws java.io.IOException
This method checks the given inputFile. If the file is a valid DBLP XML it returns true, false otherwise

Returns:
result check
Throws:
java.io.IOException

preParse

public java.lang.String preParse(int partNumber,
                                 int chkptStep)
                          throws java.lang.Exception,
                                 java.io.IOException,
                                 FileExistsException
This method pre parses the given XML file. The given file is pointed by the inputFile attribute, therefore this attribute needs to be initialized The inputFile is divided in different smaller files (_part files). In each _part file checkpoints are added between dblp "main" tags. A main tag is a tag which is a first level child of the xml tag .

Parameters:
partNumber: - the number of "_part" files to be generated, it has to be not null and greater than 0
chkptStep: - the number of dblp "main" tags between checkpoints, it has to be greater than 0
Returns:
a string containing the path of the generated descriptor xml file if the operation succeeds, null if the operation fails
Throws:
java.lang.Exception
java.io.IOException
FileExistsException

run

public void run()
Called when the thread starts, it pre-parses the given inputFile with the partNumber and chkptStep parameters.

Specified by:
run in interface java.lang.Runnable
Overrides:
run in class java.lang.Thread
